title: Interval that solves the Mean Value Theorem

content.question: Let f be the function with <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi>π</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@413D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi>π</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@413F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and derivative given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>π</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4935@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. How many values of x in the open interval (0, 2) satisfy the conclusion of the Mean Value Theorem for the function f on the closed interval [0, 2] ?

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
